wow@kaffie.bit hi
as far as i understand it, if you don't enable git hooks you would still need to push "sign and publish" button
but otherwise it's possible to git push to any number of remotes at a time
let me find relevant page..
https://gist.github.com/rvl/c3f156e117e22a25f242 for pushing to multiple repos
git hooks: https://git-scm.com/book/en/v2/Customizing-Git-Git-Hooks
as far as i understand, git center hooks are very limited, experimental and platform-dependant
also, important note about git center: to make your repos available to others you need to make sure enough people download it (i.e. bootstrapping) just like regular zite
you might want to publish link to your repo to 0list to get seeders
and final note before i leave: if i'd be learning git now, i'd read proper manuals instead of lurking around for solutions of specific issues and tutorials
have a nice git ^_^
wow@kaffie.bit you can increase allowed zite space.. but do you really have content.json at 50M or perhaps the whole zite?..
wow@kaffie.bit have you found a solution?
btw, hosting such large zites without optional files is probably not a good idea anyway

>Does ThunderWave also shows who’s online?

it shows "last-seen" which is (i think) either time of last message or of last update of chat page (that's why it shows "publishing changes" on every reload). integrating that info into chat itself shouldn't be that hard, but then i don't think anyone actively developing thunder these days
also, perhaps more important feature to add would be "desktop" notifications
psybin@zeroid.bit https://github.com/AnthyG/ThunderWave

> Do you know of any way to be notified about all messages in a group chat but not of all message in the public chat?

I suppose that would impossible in the same way as zeromail notifications are
i.e. it requires running custom code even to decide whether message belongs to a group
(otherwise groups wouldn't be "private")
~~avatars are added for priviledged users only~~ see /help , you just have to drop it agair
well, most chats have user lists, so it's not such a big problem
(except on mobile where it should be foldable, i guess)
other additions would include native notifications and auto-update (periodically, optionally) active users
but i think glightstar wanted to rewrite chat engine rather than amend this

> the updated version

> that message was actually about a completely different thing

yeah, i didn't quite get what it was supposed to be about, i just noticed you mentioned update and the group chat being empty and correlated the two ;)
there was some issue with scrolling: if you scroll too far, it messed up all the messages
a new candidate for a blocklist?

that was discussed just recently here. that's not possible with zeronet w/o plugins (and even with peermessage plugin i'm not sure there's a convenient chat implemented) because there's a 30s delay builtin (for spam-protection, i suppose)
also note that there's no notification beyond 0hello (and btw, the first mentioned worked fine)
first mention*
if your node sends requests more often than intended, it might be marked as a "rogue node". not sure if this is implemented
peer message plugin implements more realtime communication between nodes, but as i said, i'm not sure there's chat based on it
you may have better luck getting definite answer about that on 0talk or 0me though
np
